raw_text:
http://www.status8020.com
The 80% | Wholefoods Mains to Nourish
hello@status8020.com
Welcome to your new 8020 journey, Gorgeous!
This book is curated to provide you with a diverse selection of savoury meals, with the aim of to help you maintain a
 
balanced diet of 80% whole foods and 20% soul foods.
Inside, you'll ﬁnd 42 meals that you can select to make up your three main meals a day. As for that extra 20% (1
 
snack), feel free to pick a small treat of your liking, keeping it around 200 calories, or refer to my separate 'The 20%:
 
42 Sweet Treats' eBook for ideas.
Starting your day with a savoury breakfast not only helps balance blood sugar levels but also helps curb those mid-
 
afternoon cravings, and you'll ﬁnd you snack less after dinner too. Double win.
To make your journey simpler, I suggest selecting 6-12 meals that you absolutely love from this eBook and putting
 
them on rotation / meal prep - so you dont get overwhelmed. This way, you'll never get bored and you'll always have
 
something delicious to look forward to. Hop back into this ebook every few weeks to swap out some recipes to keep
 
the rotation fresh.
All recipes are for 1 person so you can scale them easily. If the recipe says '2 serves' it's becasue I want you to double
 
the ingredients for a main meal - a single serving is a snack size.
Stick with this for just 30 days, and you're guaranteed to notice positive changes. From improved energy levels to
 
better moods, clearer skin, and a balancedreduced cravings, all thanks to a diverse range of nutrients, vitamins, and
 
minerals in these meals.
If you have a speciﬁc fat loss goal, I recommend tracking these meals in MyFitnessPal (a free app!) and adjusting the
 
portions based on your personal needs.
For those looking for a more personalised approach, my Status 8020 app offers these recipes and 100’s more, but
 
adjusted speciﬁcally to your body height, weight, age, and goals. I do all the heavy lifting for you! Plus you can add
 
‘disliked’ foods to your list and select speciﬁc dietary needs such as dairy free / gluten free, easy prep, PCOS,
 
menopause, plant-based and more.
For more information or to sign up, visit www.status8020.com/programs.
Let's attack this next 30 days from ALL angles, baby. Don’t forget to drink your 2L of water, sleep 7+ hours, and try to
 
get your steps (10K day / 70K a week) completed to expedite your results.
Now... get started and make that list!
Sal x
http://www.status8020.com
Air Fryer Hot Honey Salmon Bowl
30 minutes
 
Raw Honey
 
Soy Sauce
 
Lime (juiced)
 
Garlic (clove, minced)
 
Chili Flakes
 
Salmon Fillet (skinless, cut
into large cubes)
 
Basmati Rice (dry)
 
Cucumber (medium, sliced)
 
Cilantro (chopped)
475
8g
58g
Fiber
2g
Sugar
14g
44g
Sodium
1011mg
 
Refrigerate in an airtight container for up to three days.
 
One serving is equal to approximately two cups.
 
Add ginger and onion powder to the salmon marinade. Top with sriracha
or a tahini-based sauce.
In a bowl, whisk together the honey, soy sauce, lime juice, garlic, and chili
ﬂakes. Add the salmon, stir, and let it sit in the marinade for about 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook the rice according to the package directions and set aside.
Preheat the air fryer to 400ºF (205ºC).
Transfer the salmon bites to the air fryer basket and bake for seven to eight
minutes or until cooked through, shaking halfway through.
Divide the rice, salmon, and cucumber evenly between bowls. Top with cilantro
and enjoy!
http://www.status8020.com
Turkey Taco Salad
20 minutes
 
Extra Virgin Olive Oil
 
Garlic (clove, large, minced)
 
Extra Lean Ground Turkey
 
Water (plus a splash more
for consistency)
 
Taco Seasoning
 
Sour Cream
 
Mixed Greens
 
Avocado (medium, sliced)
 
Yellow Bell Pepper (medium,
sliced)
 
Pickled Red Onions
405
27g
15g
Fiber
6g
Sugar
2g
32g
Sodium
456mg
 
Refrigerate the turkey in an airtight container for up to three days. Keep the
rest of the ingredients separate. Slice the avocado when ready to serve.
 
One serving is two cups of salad with turkey.
 
Shredded cheese, hot sauce, shredded cabbage and/or pickled
jalapeños.
 
Use chili powder instead.
 
Add tomato paste to the turkey when cooking.
Heat a cast-iron pan over medium heat. Add the oil and garlic and sauté until
fragrant, about one minute.
Add the turkey, breaking it up as it cooks. Cook for three minutes. Add the
water and taco seasoning and mix well. Cover and cook until the turkey is
cooked through.
Thin the sour cream with a splash of water to create a dressing.
Add the mixed greens to a bowl and top with the turkey, avocado, bell pepper,
and pickled onions. Drizzle the sour cream dressing on top. Enjoy!
http://www.status8020.com
Chicken Breast & Sauteed Mushrooms with Tzatziki
20 minutes
 
Avocado Oil (divided)
 
Sea Salt
 
Chicken Breast (boneless,
skinless)
 
Cremini Mushrooms (sliced)
 
Tzatziki
352
13g
2g
Fiber
0g
Sugar
2g
53g
Sodium
459mg
 
Refrigerate in an airtight container for up to three days.
 
One serving is approximately 1/3 cup of mushrooms and 2 tbsp of tzatziki
with chicken.
Add half of the oil to a large pan over medium heat.
Season the chicken with the salt and add the chicken to the pan. Cook,
covered, for seven to ten minutes, ﬂipping halfway through until cooked
through. Slice the chicken.
Add the remaining oil to the pan and sauté the mushrooms. Cook for four to
ﬁve minutes or until browned.
Spread the tzatziki onto a serving plate and top with the chicken. Add the
mushrooms to the top. Serve and enjoy!
http://www.status8020.com
Saffron Chicken & Mashed Cauliﬂower
30 minutes
 
Lemon (juiced)
 
Saffron (ground)
 
Sea Salt (divided)
 
Chicken Breast (boneless)
 
Cauliﬂower (cut into ﬂorets)
 
Extra Virgin Olive Oil (divided)
 
Parsley (chopped)
240
8g
8g
Fiber
3g
Sugar
3g
35g
Sodium
1289mg
 
Refrigerate in an airtight container for up to three days.
 
One serving is equal to 1/2 cup of mashed cauliﬂower with chicken.
 
Use turmeric instead.
 
Add zucchini or broccoli.
In a bowl, add the lemon juice, saffron, half of the salt, and chicken breast. Let
the chicken sit in the marinade for about 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, add the cauliﬂower to a pot of boiling water, cover, and cook for
ﬁve to ten minutes or until tender. Drain and mash with half of the oil and the
remaining salt.
Heat the remaining oil in a pan. Add the chicken breast and cook for 12 to 15
minutes or until cooked through, ﬂipping halfway.
Serve the chicken with mashed cauliﬂower. Season with parsley and enjoy!
http://www.status8020.com
Turkish Eggs
10 minutes
 
Egg
 
Plain Greek Yogurt (room
temperature)
 
Garlic (clove, minced)
 
Extra Virgin Olive Oil
 
Chili Flakes
Sea Salt & Black Pepper (to taste)
 
Mint Leaves (torn)
285
21g
7g
Fiber
0g
Sugar
3g
17g
Sodium
142mg
 
This is best enjoyed at room temperature immediately after making. Store
leftover eggs peeled but not sliced in the fridge for up to three days.
 
Use a plain dairy-free yogurt.
 
Rather than a soft-boiled egg, make a poached egg.
 
Use another fresh herb such as parsley, or omit.
Bring a pot of water to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat slightly and add
the eggs. Cook for seven minutes for a soft boiled egg. Once the eggs are
done, add them to a bowl of ice water. Once cooled, peel the shell.
In a small bowl, mix together the yogurt and garlic. Divide onto plates evenly.
In a small skillet, over low medium-low heat, pour in the oil and chili ﬂakes and
heat until just warmed.
Slice the eggs open down the middle and divide onto plates on top of the
yogurt. Drizzle the oil mixture over top and season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with mint. Enjoy!
http://www.status8020.com
Spicy Harissa Cod & Couscous
15 minutes
 
Couscous (uncooked)
 
Lemon (juiced, plus more for
garnish)
 
Garlic (cloves, minced)
 
Baby Spinach (chopped)
Sea Salt & Black Pepper (to taste)
 
Harissa
 
Cod Fillet (skinless)
 
Chicken Broth
320
2g
37g
Fiber
3g
Sugar
1g
38g
Sodium
180mg
 
Refrigerate in an airtight container for up to three days.
 
One serving is equal to approximately half of a cod ﬁllet and 1 1/2 cups of
couscous with spinach.
 
Fresh herbs like cilantro, chives, and/or parsley.
 
Use quinoa in place of couscous.
 
One cod ﬁllet is equal to 231 grams or 8 ounces.
Cook the couscous according to package directions. Add lemon juice, garlic,
and spinach once it's ﬁnished cooking. Stir to wilt the spinach. Season with salt
and pepper and set aside.
Meanwhile, spread the harissa over the ﬁsh.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat. Add the broth and ﬁsh to the pan and
cook for four to six minutes. Gently turn and cook for one more minute or until
the ﬁsh is just cooked. Time may vary depending on the thickness of the ﬁlet.
Divide the couscous and ﬁsh evenly between plates. Drizzle with more lemon
juice if desired and enjoy!
http://www.status8020.com
Tuna & Tomato Yogurt Lettuce Wrap
10 minutes
 
Tuna (drained)
 
Tomato (medium, diced)
 
Parsley (chopped)
 
Plain Greek Yogurt
 
Iceberg Lettuce (small, leaves
pulled apart)
115
2g
7g
Fiber
3g
Sugar
3g
20g
Sodium
258mg
 
Refrigerate in an airtight container for up to two days.
 
One serving is equal to one lettuce wrap.
 
Add fresh herbs like basil and chives.
 
Cut off the bottom end of the head of the lettuce and gently
peel the leaves to maximize the surface area.
 
Use mayonnaise or coconut yogurt instead of Greek yogurt.
 
One can of tuna is equal to 165 grams or 5.8 ounces, drained.
Mix the tuna, tomatoes, parsley, and yogurt until combined. Spread the lettuce
leaves with the mixture and roll up tightly. Enjoy!
http://www.status8020.com
Sesame Salmon & Edamame Salad
15 minutes
 
Rice Vinegar
 
Tamari
 
Sesame Oil (divided)
 
Salmon Fillet (skin on)
 
Mixed Greens
 
Cucumber (medium, sliced)
 
Frozen Edamame (thawed)
 
Radishes (sliced)
 
Green Onion (chopped)
 
Sesame Seeds (optional, for
garnish)
425
23g
16g
Fiber
8g
Sugar
5g
42g
Sodium
624mg
 
Refrigerate in an airtight container for up to three days.
 
One serving is approximately two cups of salad and 4 oz of salmon.
 
Add cherry tomatoes and cooked green beans.
Add the rice vinegar, tamari, and 2/3 of the sesame oil to a jar or small bowl.
Whisk or shake to combine.
Heat a large pan over medium heat. Once hot, add the remaining oil. Place the
salmon in the pan skin-side down, cooking for about three to ﬁve minutes or
until the skin is crispy. Flip the salmon and cook for one minute or until cooked
to your desired doneness. Remove and set aside to cool.
Place the greens on a serving dish. Top with the salmon, then place the
cucumber, edamame, and radishes around it.
Add the dressing, green onions, and sesame seeds, if desired. Enjoy!
http://www.status8020.com
Figs, Goat Cheese & Prosciutto
5 minutes
 
Fig (halved)
 
Prosciutto (thinly sliced)
 
Goat Cheese
200
9g
20g
Fiber
3g
Sugar
17g
13g
Sodium
856mg
 
Refrigerate in an airtight container for up to one day.
 
Drizzle with honey and/or chili ﬂakes.
 
Serve with crackers.
 
Use dairy-free cheese. Omit the cheese and use hummus.
Arrange the ﬁgs, prosciutto, and goat cheese on a plate and enjoy!
http://www.status8020.com
Chicken & Broccoli with Rice
30 minutes
 
Basmati Rice (dry, rinsed)
 
Extra Virgin Olive Oil
 
Chicken Thighs with Skin
(bone-in)
 
Frozen Broccoli
 
Paprika
Sea Salt & Black Pepper (to taste)
483
22g
47g
Fiber
4g
Sugar
2g
25g
Sodium
122mg
 
Refrigerate in an airtight container for three days.
 
One serving is one chicken thigh, one cup of broccoli, and 1/2 cup of
cooked rice.
 
Add minced garlic to the chicken.
 
Chopped fresh basil.
Cook the rice according to the package directions.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the chicken thighs and
cook for ﬁve to seven minutes. Flip them and add the broccoli around the
chicken. Season everything with paprika. Cover and cook for ﬁve to seven
minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
Divide the rice, chicken, and broccoli evenly between plates. Season with salt
and pepper to taste. Enjoy!
http://www.status8020.com
Roasted Chicken, Veggies & Quinoa with Tahini Sauce
30 minutes
 
Quinoa (dry)
 
Chicken Breast (boneless,
skinless)
Sea Salt & Black Pepper (to taste)
 
Paprika
 
Orange Bell Pepper (medium,
chopped)
 
Cherry Tomatoes
 
Tahini
 
Water
 
Lemon Juice
494
16g
41g
Fiber
7g
Sugar
2g
49g
Sodium
103mg
 
Refrigerate in an airtight container for up to three days. Drizzle with tahini
dressing before serving.
 
One serving is equal to approximately two cups.
 
Use tofu 
instead of chicken.
 
Add broccoli and red onion to the roasted vegetables.
 
Top with fresh herbs such as dill or parsley.
Preheat the oven to 425ºF (215ºC) and line a baking sheet with parchment
paper.
Cook the quinoa according to the package directions. Once cooked, ﬂuff with a
fork and let it cool.
Meanwhile, season the chicken with salt, pepper, and paprika. Place the
chicken, bell pepper, and cherry tomatoes on the baking sheet. Bake in the
oven for 22 to 25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
Make the dressing by whisking the tahini, water, lemon juice, salt, and pepper
together.
Chop the cooked chicken. Divide the quinoa, chicken, cherry tomatoes, and
bell peppers evenly between plates. Serve with the dressing and enjoy!
http://www.status8020.com
Salmon with Rice, Cabbage & Kale
20 minutes
 
Brown Rice (dry, rinsed)
 
Extra Virgin Olive Oil
 
Salmon Fillet
Sea Salt & Black Pepper (to taste)
 
Kale Leaves (chopped)
 
Purple Cabbage (thinly
sliced)
487
17g
43g
Fiber
4g
Sugar
4g
43g
Sodium
170mg
 
Refrigerate in an airtight container for two days.
 
One serving is 6 oz of salmon, 1/2 cup of cooked rice, and two cups of kale
and cabbage.
 
Add red chilli ﬂakes, shallots and/or garlic to the vegetables. Squeeze fresh
lemon on the salmon once it has cooked.
 
Sesame seeds, hemp seeds, chopped green onions, and/or hot
sauce.
Cook the rice according to the package directions.
Meanwhile, heat the oil in a cast-iron pan over medium heat. Pat the salmon dry
with a paper towel and season both sides with salt and pepper. Add the salmon
to the pan and cook for four to six minutes per side until cooked through.
Remove from the pan leaving the oil behind.
Add the kale and cabbage to the skillet. Cook them in the remaining oil for two
to three minutes, or until they start to soften. Add a splash of water if you prefer
them cooked down more.
Divide the rice, salmon, kale, and cabbage evenly between plates and enjoy!
http://www.status8020.com
Lemony Baked Cod with Zucchini & Mini Potatoes
35 minutes
 
Mini Potatoes
 
Extra Virgin Olive Oil
 
Lemon Juice
Sea Salt & Black Pepper (to taste)
 
Cod Fillet
 
Zucchini (medium, sliced into
strips)
 
Capers
 
Fresh Dill (chopped)
360
9g
25g
Fiber
4g
Sugar
4g
45g
Sodium
241mg
 
Refrigerate in an airtight container for up to three days.
 
One serving is equal to one cod ﬁllet and approximately 1 1/2 cups of
potato and zucchini.
 
Add bell pepper, broccoli, and cherry tomatoes.
 
Omit or use parsley instead.
 
One cod ﬁllet is equal to 231 grams or 8 ounces.
Preheat the oven to 425ºF (220ºC). Place the potatoes, oil, and lemon juice in a
deep baking dish or rimmed tray. Toss and season with salt and pepper.
Bake in the oven for 20 minutes. Remove the baking sheet from the oven, add
the cod ﬁllet and zucchini. Sprinkle the capers on top, and season the ﬁsh and
zucchini with salt and pepper.
Bake in the oven for another 15 to 20 minutes or until everything is cooked
through.
Top with fresh dill and enjoy!
http://www.status8020.com
Parmesan Asparagus & Poached Eggs
15 minutes
 
Asparagus (ends trimmed)
 
Egg (large)
 
Balsamic Vinaigrette
 
Parmigiano Reggiano (shaved)
Sea Salt & Black Pepper (to taste)
208
14g
7g
Fiber
3g
Sugar
4g
14g
Sodium
234mg
 
Best enjoyed immediately.
 
One serving is equal to approximately one cup of asparagus and one egg.
 
Serve with a toast.
 
Omit the parmesan cheese.
Bring a pot of water to a boil. Add the asparagus and cook for two minutes to
blanche. Remove the asparagus from the boiling water with tongs and set
aside.
Reduce to a simmer. One at a time, break the eggs into a small dish and gently
slip each egg into the water. Cook for three minutes for a soft egg, then use a
slotted spoon to carefully remove the poached egg onto a paper towel-lined
plate to soak up the excess liquid.
Divide the asparagus and eggs onto plates. Drizzle with vinaigrette and top
with parmesan cheese. Season to taste and enjoy!
http://www.status8020.com
Bison, Rapini & Rice
20 minutes
 
Jasmine Rice (dry)
 
Rapini (chopped)
 
Ground Bison
 
Oregano (dried)
 
Sea Salt (to taste)
339
8g
40g
Fiber
3g
Sugar
0g
28g
Sodium
246mg
 
Refrigerate in an airtight container for up to three days.
 
One serving equals approximately two cups.
 
Add onions, garlic, and black pepper.
 
Use ground beef, turkey, chicken, tempeh, or ﬁrm tofu instead.
Cook the rice according to package directions.
Bring a pot of water to a boil. Cook the rapini for two minutes or until tender
crisp. Drain and set aside.
Meanwhile, heat a pan over medium heat. Add the bison, oregano, and salt.
Cook for ﬁve to eight minutes, breaking it up as it cooks. Drain extra fat if
needed.
Divide the rice, rapini, and bison onto plates. Enjoy!
http://www.status8020.com
One Pan Turmeric Salmon with Cauliﬂower & Sweet
Potato
45 minutes
 
Sweet Potato (medium, chopped)
 
Cauliﬂower (cut into ﬂorets)
 
Extra Virgin Olive Oil
 
Turmeric
 
Garlic Powder
 
Lemon Juice
 
Salmon Fillet
345
13g
19g
Fiber
4g
Sugar
5g
41g
Sodium
191mg
 
Refrigerate in an airtight container for two days.
 
One serving is 6 oz of salmon, approximately one cup of sweet potato, and
one cup of cauliﬂower.
 
Add minced garlic and shallot to the marinade.
 
Chopped cilantro, dill, and/or sesame seeds.
Preheat the oven to 375ºF (190ºC). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Place the sweet potato and cauliﬂower on the baking sheet.
Mix the oil, turmeric, garlic powder, and lemon juice. Brush the marinade onto
the salmon ﬁllets and set aside at room temperature.
Add the remaining marinade to the cauliﬂower and sweet potato and toss to
coat. Bake for 20 minutes.
Add the salmon to the baking sheet and bake everything for another 20
minutes or until the salmon is cooked through and the vegetables are soft and
browning around the edges.
Divide evenly between plates and enjoy!
http://www.status8020.com
Southwest Chicken Meal Prep Bowls
50 minutes
 
Brown Rice
 
Chicken Breast
 
Avocado Oil (divided)
 
Taco Seasoning (divided)
 
Unsweetened Coconut
Yogurt
 
Lime Juice
 
Cilantro
 
Green Cabbage (thinly sliced)
 
Green Bell Pepper (medium,
chopped)
 
Tomato (medium, chopped)
415
11g
48g
Fiber
5g
Sugar
4g
31g
Sodium
293mg
 
Refrigerate in an airtight container for up to three days. Serve cold or to
reheat store the cabbage, veggies, and yogurt separately from the chicken and rice.
 
Add red pepper ﬂakes, smoked paprika, or cayenne pepper to the taco
seasoning. Season with salt if needed.
 
Lime wedges, cilantro, or chopped green onion.
 
Use quinoa or cauliﬂower rice instead.
 
Use romaine lettuce or kale instead.
Preheat the oven to 400ºF (204ºC).
Cook the rice according to package directions. Let the rice cool slightly.
Meanwhile, place the chicken breast in a baking dish and season both sides
with 1/2 of the oil and 2/3 of the taco seasoning. 
Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or
until the chicken breast is cooked through. Let cool for 10 to 15 minutes then
slice.
Meanwhile, in a small bowl combine the coconut yogurt, lime juice, cilantro, the
remaining oil, and the remaining taco seasoning to make a dressing.
Divide the rice, cabbage, peppers, tomato, and chicken between bowls. Serve
with the yogurt dressing. Enjoy!

Beef Jerky, Apple & Peanut Butter
5 minutes
 
Apple (sliced)
 
All Natural Peanut Butter
 
Beef Jerky
404

Fiber
6g

25g
17g

513mg
 
Best enjoyed immediately.
Add ingredients to a plate or snack box. Enjoy!

Pea & Basil Frittata
20 minutes
 
Fresh Peas (or frozen and
thawed)
 
Basil Leaves (chopped)
 
Sea Salt
 
Egg (whisked)
 
Avocado Oil Spray
167
7g
11g
Fiber
4g
Sugar
4g
13g
Sodium
405mg
 
Refrigerate in an airtight container for up to three days. Freeze for up to two
months.
 
A six-inch cast-iron pan was used to make two servings. One serving is
roughly half of the pan.
 
Add feta cheese.
 
One gram (or 1/16 oz) of avocado oil spray is equal to a one-second
spray.
Preheat the oven to 400ºF (205ºC). Add in the peas, basil, and salt to the
whisked eggs. Stir to combine.
Spray a cast-iron pan or an oven-safe dish with oil. Pour the egg mixture into the
pan.
Bake in the oven for 15 to 17 minutes or until the eggs have set. Slice the
frittata and enjoy!
http://www.status8020.com
One Pan Steak & Eggs
30 minutes
 
Parsley (chopped)
 
Mint Leaves (chopped)
 
Garlic (cloves, minced)
 
Extra Virgin Olive Oil
 
Lemon Juice
 
Ribeye Steak, Boneless
(room temperature)
Sea Salt & Black Pepper (to taste)
 
Egg
320
21g
4g
Fiber
0g
Sugar
0g
29g
Sodium
173mg
 
Best served immediately. Store steak and eggs separate from the sauce in an
airtight container in the fridge for up to two days. Reheat in skillet for the best result.
 
Cook the steak with rosemary and thyme.
 
Use cilantro instead.
 
Omit or use tarragon or dill.
In a small bowl combine the parsley, mint, garlic, oil, and lemon juice. Set it
aside.
Pat the steak very dry with paper towel. Season with salt and pepper.
Heat a cast-iron skillet over medium heat until hot. Place the steak in the middle
of the skillet and cook for 10 to 12 minutes, ﬂipping and turning every two to
three minutes, until a dark crust has formed on both sides and the steak is
cooked to your liking. Remove and let rest for about 10 minutes.
In the same skillet, crack the eggs, season with salt and pepper, and cook until
the whites are set and the yolk is cooked to your liking. Take the skillet off the
heat.
Spoon the parsley sauce over the steak and eggs. Serve and enjoy!
http://www.status8020.com
Hummus & Tuna Stuffed Avocado
10 minutes
 
Hummus
 
Tuna (drained)
 
Avocado (small, halved and pitted)
 
Chives (chopped)
429
33g
19g
Fiber
14g
Sugar
1g
21g
Sodium
283mg
 
Refrigerate the tuna mixture separately from the avocado. Cut the avocado
only when you are ready to serve.
 
One serving is one small avocado and 1/2 can of tuna.
 
Add capers, minced red onion and/or dill to the tuna mixture.
 
One can of tuna is equal to 165 grams or 5.8 ounces, drained.
Mix the hummus and tuna together in a small bowl. Fill each half of the avocado
with the tuna ﬁlling and garnish with the chives. Enjoy!
http://www.status8020.com
Shredded Brussels Sprouts Caesar Salad
15 minutes
 
Brussels Sprouts (trimmed,
shredded)
 
Bread (cubed, toasted)
 
Caesar Dressing
Sea Salt & Black Pepper (to taste)
 
Parmigiano Reggiano
107
3g
17g
Fiber
4g
Sugar
5g
5g

Refrigerate in an airtight container for up to two days.
 
One serving is equal to approximately 1 1/2 cups.
 
Omit the parmesan cheese and use a vegan caesar dressing instead.
 
Serve with your choice of cooked protein.
 
Use gluten-free bread.
 
Use a food processor to shred the Brussels sprouts.
Add all the ingredients to a large bowl. Toss to combine. Divide the salad
between plates and enjoy!
http://www.status8020.com
One Pan Steak & Parmesan Broccoli
15 minutes
 
Top Sirloin Steak
 
Broccoli (chopped into
ﬂorets)
 
Coconut Oil (melted)
Sea Salt & Black Pepper (to taste)
 
Lemon (sliced)
 
Parmigiano Reggiano
407
27g
10g

4g

3g

Refrigerate in an airtight container for up to three days.
 
Use vegan cheese instead of parmesan or omit completely.
 
Add your choice of herbs and spices.
 
Serve with sweet potatoes, cauliﬂower mash, brown rice, mixed
greens, or quinoa.
Preheat the oven to broil.
Arrange the steaks and broccoli ﬂorets onto a baking sheet. Coat in oil and
season with salt and pepper. Arrange the lemon slices over top. Broil for about
eight minutes, ﬂipping the steaks and broccoli halfway.
Remove from the oven and sprinkle parmesan over the broccoli. Broil until the
cheese is melted and the broccoli is golden brown, about one to two minutes.
Slice the steak and divide onto plates with the parmesan broccoli. Enjoy!

Eggs, Almonds & Cheese Cubes

Egg
 
Almonds
 
Cheddar Cheese (cubed)

9g

4g
Sugar
2g
27g

327mg
 
Refrigerate in an airtight container for up to two days.
 
Season the eggs with salt, pepper and/or chili ﬂakes.
 
Use dairy-free cheese.
Place the eggs in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil over high
heat. Once boiling, turn off the heat but keep the saucepan on the hot burner.
Cover and let sit for 10 to 12 minutes.
Strain the water and ﬁll the saucepan with cold water. Let the eggs sit until cool
enough to handle. Peel and cut the eggs in half.
Arrange the eggs, almonds, and cheese into a container and enjoy!
http://www.status8020.com
Grilled Steak & Wild Rice Salad
45 minutes
 
Wild Rice (dry)
 
Extra Virgin Olive Oil
(divided)
 
Steak Spice Seasoning
 
Top Sirloin Steak
 
Mixed Greens
